intro: Orbea maculata subsp. rangeana, commonly known as the spotted orbea, is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a flowering plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
